meanings.definition: To administer an excessive amount of medication.
meanings.sent1: The doctor warned not to overmedicate the patient with too many pills.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overmedicate children with unnecessary antibiotics.
meanings.sent3: The nurse accidentally overmedicate the patient, causing a funny mix-up.
meanings.sent4: Trying to overmedicate a simple headache can sometimes make it worse.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of overmedicating can be harmful to one's health.

meanings.definition: To treat with too much medication.
meanings.sent1: Caregivers should never overmedicate elderly patients with multiple drugs.
meanings.sent2: Some doctors tend to overmedicate their patients without considering side effects.
meanings.sent3: The pharmacist jokingly said he would overmedicate his friend with vitamins.
meanings.sent4: Overmedicating a minor illness can lead to unnecessary complications.
meanings.sent5: It's crucial for healthcare providers to avoid overmedicating their patients.
